verses.kjv: The burden of the word of the LORD for Israel, saith the LORD, which stretcheth forth the heavens, and layeth the foundation of the earth, and formeth the spirit of man within him.
verses.ct: A prophetic message — the word of the LORD concerning Israel. The LORD, who stretched out the heavens, laid the foundation of the earth, and forms the spirit of a person within them, declares:

verses.kjv: Behold, I will make Jerusalem a cup of trembling unto all the people round about, when they shall be in the siege both against Judah and against Jerusalem.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — I am going to make Jerusalem like a cup of staggering wine for all the surrounding nations. When they lay siege to Jerusalem, Judah will also be under attack.

verses.kjv: And in that day will I make Jerusalem a burdensome stone for all people: all that burden themselves with it shall be cut in pieces, though all the people of the earth be gathered together against it.
verses.ct: On that day I will make Jerusalem an immovable rock for all the nations. Everyone who tries to lift it will be torn apart, even if every nation on earth gathers against it.

verses.kjv: In that day, saith the LORD, I will smite every horse with astonishment, and his rider with madness: and I will open mine eyes upon the house of Judah, and will smite every horse of the people with blindness.
verses.ct: On that day," declares the LORD, "I will strike every horse with panic and every rider with insanity. I will watch over the people of Judah, but I will strike the horses of every enemy nation with blindness.

verses.kjv: And the governors of Judah shall say in their heart, The inhabitants of Jerusalem shall be my strength in the LORD of hosts their God.
verses.ct: Then the leaders of Judah will say to themselves, 'The people of Jerusalem are our strength, through the LORD of Hosts, their God.'

verses.kjv: In that day will I make the governors of Judah like an hearth of fire among the wood, and like a torch of fire in a sheaf; and they shall devour all the people round about, on the right hand and on the left: and Jerusalem shall be inhabited again in her own place, even in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: On that day I will make the leaders of Judah like a firepot among woodpiles, like a blazing torch among bundles of grain. They will consume all the surrounding nations on every side, and Jerusalem will be inhabited once again in its own place — right there in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: The LORD also shall save the tents of Judah first, that the glory of the house of David and the glory of the inhabitants of Jerusalem do not magnify themselves against Judah.
verses.ct: The LORD will rescue the rest of Judah first, so that the honor of David's royal family and the honor of Jerusalem's residents won't be elevated above the rest of Judah.

verses.kjv: In that day shall the LORD defend the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and he that is feeble among them at that day shall be as David; and the house of David shall be as God, as the angel of the LORD before them.
verses.ct: On that day the LORD will shield the people living in Jerusalem. The weakest among them on that day will be like David, and David's royal family will be like God — like the angel of the LORD going ahead of them.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that I will seek to destroy all the nations that come against Jerusalem.
verses.ct: On that day I will set out to destroy every nation that attacks Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And I will pour upon the house of David, and upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the spirit of grace and of supplications: and they shall look upon me whom they have pierced, and they shall mourn for him, as one mourneth for his only son, and shall be in bitterness for him, as one that is in bitterness for his firstborn.
verses.ct: I will pour out a spirit of grace and prayer on David's family and on the residents of Jerusalem. They will look at me — the one they have pierced — and they will grieve for him the way someone grieves for an only child. They will weep bitterly for him, like the bitter weeping over a firstborn son.

verses.kjv: In that day shall there be a great mourning in Jerusalem, as the mourning of Hadadrimmon in the valley of Megiddon.
verses.ct: On that day the mourning in Jerusalem will be as intense as the mourning at Hadadrimmon in the valley of Megiddon.

verses.kjv: And the land shall mourn, every family apart; the family of the house of David apart, and their wives apart; the family of the house of Nathan apart, and their wives apart;
verses.ct: The whole land will mourn, each family by itself — the family of David's house by itself, with their wives separately; the family of Nathan's house by itself, with their wives separately;

verses.kjv: The family of the house of Levi apart, and their wives apart; the family of Shimei apart, and their wives apart;
verses.ct: the family of Levi's house by itself, with their wives separately; the family of Shimei by itself, with their wives separately;

verses.kjv: All the families that remain, every family apart, and their wives apart.
verses.ct: and all the remaining families, each family by itself, with their wives separately.
